Detailed Description

template<typename Scalar, typename LNO, typename GNO, typename AppGID>
class Zoltan2::ObjectSource< Scalar, LNO, GNO, AppGID >

The adapter class for specific mesh, graph, hypergraph or matrix sources.

Zoltan2::ObjectSource

The ObjectSource presents a uniform interface to the Zoltan methods for the distributed object to be partitioned, ordered, or colored. The actual data may come from sources as diverse as a Tpetra_CrsMatrix, an Exodus II file, a view into the caller's arrays, or from legacy Zoltan1 query functions.

virtual bool Zoltan2::ObjectSource< Scalar, LNO, GNO, AppGID >::has_dense_matrix (  )  [inline, virtual]

True if ObjectSource is stored in dense matrix format.

The function using the ObjectSource may be able to use it more efficiently if it know how it is stored.

template<typename Scalar, typename LNO, typename GNO, typename AppGID>
virtual void Zoltan2::ObjectSource< Scalar, LNO, GNO, AppGID >::number_of_vertices ( GNO &  global_count,
LNO &  local_count 
) [inline, virtual]

Returns the global and local number of vertices.

Vertices may also be abstract objects known only by an ID. We call them "vertices" because the normal use case is geometric or a graph.

Parameters:
global_count will contain the global number of vertices on return
local_count will contain the local number of vertices on return

template<typename Scalar, typename LNO, typename GNO, typename AppGID>
virtual int Zoltan2::ObjectSource< Scalar, LNO, GNO, AppGID >::caller_gid_list ( AppGID *&  gids  )  [inline, virtual]

Returns the applications's object global IDs.

TODO: we should be able to do partitioning without having global IDs from the application when there's no connectivity. The Zoltan methods shouldn't call this - they will work with GNOs. But when creating or reading the Result object, they need the AppGIDs.

Parameters:
gids will contain a pointer to the application's global IDs on return

template<typename Scalar, typename LNO, typename GNO, typename AppGID>
virtual int Zoltan2::ObjectSource< Scalar, LNO, GNO, AppGID >::global_number_list ( GNO *  gnos  )  [inline, virtual]

Returns the library's global numbering for the objects.

Info returned by other methods is in the order corresponding to the order of the gnos in this list.

Parameters:
gnos will contain a pointer to the ObjectSource's global numbers on return

template<typename Scalar, typename LNO, typename GNO, typename AppGID>
virtual LNO Zoltan2::ObjectSource< Scalar, LNO, GNO, AppGID >::gno_to_lno ( GNO  gno  )  [virtual]

Return the local number corresponding to the global number.

Local numbers are consecutive numbers beginning at 0 for each process. Global numbers are consecutive across the application and begin at 0.

TODO - local/global/application ID management is likely to be the same across all sources. Maybe this should be done in the base class.

TODO - for efficiency, list versions of these calls.

template<typename Scalar, typename LNO, typename GNO, typename AppGID>

Return the global number corresponding to the local number.
